attributes.action: Immediately the UK does not leave the EU on 29/03/2019, call a general election
attributes.background: Mrs. May has made clear her position to deliver Brexit on time. Should she not be able to deliver this the country must have a say in what happens next via a general election. A new government is, in my humble view, the fastest way to bring certainty back to the country.

attributes.action: Increase the sentence time for those caught endangering aircraft with drones
attributes.background: A maximum sentence of 5 years for endangering aircraft, those on board, people on the ground as well as the untold catastrophic disruption is too short. I feel that this maximum sentence should be increased to reflect the criminally reckless and dangerous behaviour
attributes.additional_details:
It only took two drones to cause widespread mayhem at Gatwick airport on the 19th and 20th of December requiring the armed forces to be deployed.

Given the widespread and increasing availability of drone technology a stronger sentence is the best deterrent to stop further breaches of aircraft safety through drone technology.

A stronger sentence will prevent even the accidental breach of security as operators will be greatly aware of the consequences of flying a drone in restricted airspace.

attributes.action: Introduce heavy taxation on palm oil so businesses remove it from their products
attributes.background: We lose 25 orangutans per day, largely due to the palm oil industry which requires the burning of trees such as the oil palm, which is their natural habitat. The government should heavily tax palm oil so businesses are discouraged from using it in their products and find other, better alternatives.
attributes.additional_details: Iceland state that they're removing palm oil from all of their own label products which shows that it is more than possible for businesses to do and to follow suit. Therefore, I am calling for heavy taxation on palm oil so it is not financially viable for businesses to use it, and therefore they find a less damaging and more ethical alternative.

attributes.action: Make the date of leaving the eu our uk independance day
attributes.background: When we leave the eu it will be a great part of our uk history. So calling it our independance day could be celibrated by future generations.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Ensure cyber bullying attacks both real person and fake accounts are investigated by the police and persons dealt with accordingly. Cyber bullying makes our young people and adults twice as likely to self harm. We are seeing people taking their own life because of this. Police are not preventing.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for there to be CCTV in special and PRU schools
attributes.background: Special needs schools and PRU settings often need to use restraint procedures on children to ensure the safety of children and staff. During a restraint, my son has sustained 16 injuries on his face, neck, arms, legs, chest, abdomen and back. CCTV would ensure that incidents can be investigated.
attributes.additional_details: If schools had CCTV there would be no question about these events. Staff and parents could watch the events unfold and staff can be held to account if needed, or shown to be using resonable force if they were. It is important that there is an unbiased view of the events as when a child needs restraining, emotions run high, as often staff can get hurt. CCTV would show what happened and why and mean that it is easy and transparent to investigate.

attributes.action: Make it an offence not to have poo bags with you if you are out with your dog.
attributes.background: Many weekends picking up dog poo from Children's football pitches and hearing the excuse from irresponsible dog owners that they have forgotten their bags.  Not enough wardens to catch them in the act so make it an offence not to come prepared and allow spot checks with hefty fines.

attributes.action: Set a per person minimum rate that councils must pay care providers
attributes.background: CQC’s annual State of Care report recently highlighted the trend of home care operators handing back contracts to councils because they can no longer afford to honour them.
attributes.additional_details: "Allied Healthcare are not the only major care provider experiencing financial problems.” - Bidding to provide care services which in itself is an acceptable system if applied correctly and driven by quality first and cost second. However what is not acceptable is that some under pressure Local Authorities are dictating the rates paid to service providers, and working on the most economically advantageous model of commissioning.

attributes.action: Support unmarried couples when a partner/civil partner dies in the relationship
attributes.background: The law should reflect on the deceased’s ‘living’ circumstances and life choices in who should be supported financially especially when a WILL is not in place against that the law protects and supports only them of a married status.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my partner who I was with for 2 and a half years and we have a son who was aged 1 at the time of my partners passing. He had started divorce proceedings with his previous partner but yet these where not finalised at his time of death due to amendments needed to the paperwork. I received no financial support from government bereavement support and myself and my son received no financial support from his estate. He did not have a will and government and estate finances were all awarded to his previous partner

attributes.action: Landlords should make a compulsory fee of £10 from rents to support homelessness
attributes.background: After seeing the incredible amount of homelessness within London and the obscene rental prices of houses, I want to see it become compulsory for landlords to give £10 out of London and £20 inner London per house to homelessness to fund better shelters / housing / general accomadation !
attributes.additional_details:
With London’s population of 8.6 million, 50% of these are in rental properties. The average house price being £743,000 it is no wonder landlords are cashing in on the ever growing need to rent. 
I truly believe that a small percentage of these rental fees would not be missed and would assist homelessness and make a considerable difference ! 
Please sign this petition to support this cause, Our children’s generation need this massive problem rectifying before it’s too late !!!

attributes.action: Make all products state on the label whether they have used animal testing
attributes.background: Many people are against animal testing or want to reduce the number of products they buy that use it but there isn't enough information in store about the companies that use animal testing so people are generally unaware about the extent of it. This addition would allow a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: Due to medical progress now, many agree that animal testing should only be used when completely necessary yet the U.K. are still estimated to be in the top 9 testers in the world. People should be more aware of what's go in to the product in front of them, right there in the shop without having to search online. At total of 3.79 million experiments were conducted by the U.K. In 2017

attributes.action: Make abusers pay financial costs for forced marriage and honour abuse victims
attributes.background: When victims are abroad unfortunately to be rescued those victims over the age of 18 end up in thousands of debt to the Home Office before they start their new life! Home office help the victims but unfortunately victims have to repay their travel costs etc. Abusers should be billed not victims.
attributes.additional_details: As a victim of honour abuse and walking away at the age of 30 it came with a huge financial burden that was hard to cope with! Victims deal with more than enough like social isolation, mental health, live in hiding due to their safety etc.

attributes.action: Sexual Assault law must not focus on perpetrator perception
attributes.background: In court a perpetrator may say "it was my perception she consented" and he/she will face no consequence for his actions. Informed consent should be written in law. Consent must be verbalised every time, and can be withdrawn at any time, with no punitive consequence.
attributes.additional_details: The law must say consent cannot be given by anyone asleep, under the influence of drugs or alcohol being unable to express a view, or those without physical capacity to object whether through temporary or permanent disability or because unconscious. Rape is a violent crime designed to humiliate and break people.

attributes.action: Leave the EU with no deal, free trade with the commonwealth
attributes.background: The British people voted to leave the EU not stay in the EU in every practical sense. Morals come above money, if our economy is slightly hurt it is worth the price of self rule, freedom and pride. We should build strong trade bonds with the common wealth but no free movement of people.

attributes.action: Put a Childcare Levy in place to help working families with childcare costs.
attributes.background: The majority of the existing childcare support options are income based and do not incentivise women to go back to work.  To claim and access childcare support is difficult. Even though the government spends £7.5n in childcare support per year, it only covers a fraction of families’ childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: We need a well-rounded childcare infrastructure that helps working families with childcare costs and incentive women to go back to work. We need the government to incentivise companies to offer childcare arrangements as part of their benefits umbrella. We need a Childcare Levy to cover childcare costs of working parents for children up to the age of 5. We need a register of childcarers so that parents can leave their children in safe hands. www.childcarelevy.co.uk

attributes.action: Require child maintenance to be set as at flat rate per child per month.
attributes.background: Why should child maintenance payments increase because of higher earnings? A flat fee would encourage continuity for paying and receiving parents and make the whole system much fairer. It would create equality between parents
attributes.additional_details:
Child benefit is a flat rate of £20.70 per week for the first child, if child maintenance was to be set at a flat rate it would make for a better and more efficient system. Paying parents would be able to earn more without being pushed into poverty, and receiving parents will gain security in receiving continual payments regardless of contact.
 
The cost of raising a child should not be based on what the non-resident parents are earning.

attributes.action: Save our Planet. Cap plastic bags to 4 per person & raise price to 25p per bag.
attributes.background:
Hello, my fellow Earth dwellers. 

My name is Dua Parizay Khan, like most of you, I love my UK, I love my Oceans and I love my Earth. 

By making this petition I am doing a teensy-weensy part of my little bit for my Planet  & by signing it you can do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
As we are aware, plastic is having a horrendous impact on our beautiful planet.

Plastic bags should be banned altogether but that will take time. however, in the meanwhile, we need to address the problem immediately and I think this is the best temporary but immediate solution. 

If you're worried about the inconvenience of remembering to bring your bags every time &  having to pay an extra 20p then please do watch the BBC documentary called 'Drowning in Plastic'.


Thank you.

attributes.action: Give all farmed animals access to fresh air and daylight.
attributes.background: Farmed animals can be kept in near darkness with no access to fresh air or natural light spending their whole lives in sheds that are little more than dungeons. The denial of natural light and fresh intensifies great suffering to intelligent and sentient life forms.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence of such practices and concomitant suffering is plentiful. I use these examples but there are many. This YouTube film is about the abuses of factory farmed animals but the birds and pigs can clearly be seen to have little or no access to daylight or fresh air - increasing the risks to animal and human health.

https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/press-releases/2017/07/new-interactive-map-exposes-uk-factory-farming-hotspots

https://youtu.be/IVGR1N2Pl00

attributes.action: Make it an offence to leave a dog unattended for 12 hours
attributes.background: As a nation of dog lovers, I’m sure people would be horrified to discover that is allowed by law to leave a dog unattended to for 24 hours. This is a form of neglect and causes stress to the dog. Dogs need companionship, stimulation and be able to toilet suitably. Please help me in changing this.
attributes.additional_details: As far as I am aware the laws on domestic pets have only changed once since 1911 and currently do not reflect the expected care of duty a responsible and caring dog owner would have for their family pet dog.

attributes.action: Independent review of unfair fines on drivers by local councils.
attributes.background: In recent years councils (despite it being illegal to use cameras as a revenue stream), have used cameras to catch motorists committing minor misdemeanours, raking in millions of pounds each year.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe motorists are now being seen as easy pickings and are used as "Cash Cows". In many cases it appears councils are turning a blind eye to Bad Signage over and above the safety of the general public. 
The internet, national and local press are littered with examples but in only very few cases have councils been held to task and refunded fines. There should be an independent review of the law.
Almost every motoring organisation has at some time highlighted the problem but still seem powerless to put a stop to this highway robbery. 
With your support we can force a debate in parliament.

attributes.action: Sanction Jair Bolsonsaro’s Brazil if they reverse laws protecting the Amazon.
attributes.background: Jair Bolsonsaro government threatens to destroy the Amazon rainforest. It is the responsibility of the world’s other nations to intervene. The destruction of the world’s most valuable ecological resource will have knock on environmental effects that threaten the whole planet and not just Brazil.

attributes.action: Introduce carbon tax in the UK.
attributes.background: The UN recently reported that we have 12 years to reduce carbon emission by 45% or we will face a climate change catastrophe. According to a study published by the Guardian it is reported that just 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global emissions. We need to take action!
attributes.additional_details:
By introducing a carbon tax it will encourage companies emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide will lower their carbon footprint or companies will turn to renewable energy.  This is real and cannot be avoided, going vegan, having a shower instead of a bath, cycling all help but companies emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere need to dealt with.
Watch this video here for more information - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CilVymuAM8A

attributes.action: Add Religious Studies onto the English Baccalaureate
attributes.background: I have to do the EBacc. In my school this means we only get one free choice. For GCSE my dream is to do RE, Resistant Material as my optional subjects, however I am only allowed to do one of these. If RE was a humanity I could fulfil my dream.
attributes.additional_details: I don’t understand why Michael Gove did not include RE as an EBacc subject. I believe that all students should have the option to do RE, History or Geography as they all classify as humanities. Furthermore, RE promotes pupils' spiritual, moral, social and cultural development, and prepares all students for the opportunities, responsibilities and experiences of the present and the future. Finally making RE more accessible to us will help us better understand and appreciate other people’s beliefs.

attributes.action: Strip Southeastern Railway of its ill managed franchise.
attributes.background: Southeastern Railway is making the lives of commuters miserable. Those in SE London and Kent are getting to work late, getting home late and packed into cattle like carriages on a daily basis, whilst paying thousands a year for the privilege .They do not deserve the benefit of this franchise.

attributes.action: All Ballot papers for all elections should have a box saying “none of the above”
attributes.background: Many people want to use their vote but don’t feel  that any of the options on the ballot paper don’t represent their views enough for people to vote for a particular party or person . A voter should have the option  to register that they have made a vote but don’t not for what is on offer
attributes.additional_details: This may be seen as a negative but it actually people being positive about wanting to vote and using their rights but also telling parties you’re not doing enough to listen to what I think I’m prepared to vote but only for what I want not what you’re telling me I should want .  Voted shouldn’t feel forced into either not voting or voting for a party they don’t agree with because they want to keep the right to vote . People can register this disapproval with what’s on offer and even the current system

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit on the motorways/dual carrigeways to 85mph!
attributes.background: 1967 was the year when the 70mph speed limit was set, since then cars, roads and driving moral improved a lot. Today 90% of the cars on the roads been made after 2005, these cars are all equipped with all the safety features to safely travel on higer speed.
attributes.additional_details:
Higher speed limit must come with mandatory minimum that should be 60mph!

Belgium, France, Holland, Germany all has a higher speed limit than Uk to improve the traffic flow on their motorways, in my personal opinion this could be a solution for England aswell.

Austria just started to test a new 87mph speed limit on a 30miles section, if that works well they will raise the limit on all of their motorways.

attributes.action: License Push Bikes
attributes.background:
Who has had enough of being left with the repair costs, when involved in an accident with a push bike? 
Personally I am sick of being left at the roadside after a bike has hit my vehicle and then fled the scene.
attributes.additional_details:
The Motor Car Act 1903, required all motor vehicles to be entered on an official vehicle register, and to carry alphanumeric plates. The Act was passed in order that vehicles could be easily traced in the event of an accident or contravention of the law. 
It’s seem evidently obvious that this should apply to push bike, so they can be held accountable for their actions.
Let all get together and make a difference, sign this petition and let’s get our voice heard.

attributes.action: Increase funding to police forces
attributes.background: As aired on ‘crimewave 2018: a lawless Britain’ 9 out of 10 crimes go unsolved and police lack resources.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has suffered from the increase of crime especially knife crime as well as an increase of burglaries over the past year, this is the result of decreased funding the government has given the police. We now need the government to give police forces in England and Wales enough funds to be able to put more police officers on our streets to keep the public safe and to increase funding. They should also increase funding to Scotland and Northern Ireland so that they can do the same.

attributes.action: 15 free hours of child care to all children aged 2years+
attributes.background: I believe it is unfair to offer free child care to some children and not to others. Parents are missing out on their children because they are having to work so much to pay extortionate childcare costs. 15 hours should be for all children irrespective of their background.
attributes.additional_details: Let's get as many signatures as possible and hopefully get the government to take note as something needs to change! Give parents a little help with their childcare, give all children equal opportunities at early development and social skills whilst enabling working parents to spend more time raising their own children.

attributes.action: Make registration of white goods law, to locate the owners of fly tipping.
attributes.background: White goods' including Fridge Freezers' are being dumped around local areas all over the UK. It's a hazard and hard to recycle furthermore costly to local councils, spending our money on clearing it up when it could be spent in other ways.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone should take responsibility to clear this kind of waste correctly and a registration of all good at the point of sale should be taken. This will not only ensure we dispose more safely but be able to retrace the owners if found illegally dumped. Please take responsibility and sign this petition to ensure its bought to government for debate.

attributes.action: To ask the UK government to investigate the contract given to Seaborne freight.
attributes.background: Seaborne Freight was awarded a contract of £13.8 million to operate a Ro Ro ferry service between Ostend and Ramsgate. Seaborne Freight currently do not own or operate any vessel required to carry out such an operation they also have no trading background or licenses pertaining to such a service.
attributes.additional_details: We believe the government has not shown any "due diligence" or has followed any tender regulations in awarding this contract to Seaborne Freight, therefore we call on the government to suspend this contract as it seems to be illegal and underhand pending a full investigation into why it was awarded and other legitimate companies were not asked to tender. Thank you

attributes.action: Make any form of bullying a punishable criminal offence
attributes.background:
As my son is suffering continued bullying and nothing being done . 
And to stop other children being bullied.

attributes.action: Require a child train fare to be ages 5-16 whilst in full time education
attributes.background: Rail companies define child fares as from age 5-15. But a 16 year old can still be at school (Year 11) and has to pay an adult fare.
attributes.additional_details: Companies cite the young person railcard however this cannot be used for morning fares, season tickets or fares under a certain cost. Student discounts aren't available until Year 12. This means that in their most important year 16 year old children and their family are facing the stress of paying double the amount. http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/times_fares/46494.aspx

attributes.action: Implement a scheme to make political voting more accessible for autistic adults.
attributes.background:
Voting can be challenging for people with autism, and there aren't many resources available to assist individuals with this process.
We would like to propose a [Government Run Practice Vote event] which will help reduce the pressure individuals may face from voting.
attributes.additional_details:
Autistic individuals are often affected by interruption in their daily schedule. Voting stations can cause stress due to unfamiliarity and the inability to plan the process. In addition to the practice vote, we would introduce a designated quiet hour.
Associating information with voting slips can be difficult for some. Introducing colour representation of each party will be easier to remind individuals about the information they have learnt with colour assosiation.

attributes.action: Strengthen laws & policies on terror suspects and those linked to terror groups
attributes.background: The UK and the European Union as a whole need to strengthen policies and laws on those individuals linked to terrorism. It is clear that close surveillance on those individuals is failing the public as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: The deaths at the Manchester Arena bombing and most recently the decapitation of two tourists in Morocco by a group which was known to have close ties to ISIS. We need new laws that allow authorities to hold suspects for unlimited time until thorough investigations have been taken, there should also be strengthened laws on allowing imprisonment and deportation ( in cases of foreign criminals) to be authorised. The rights to live a life without fear and the duty to protect the public interest heavily outweighs the rights of the individual.

attributes.action: Scrap interest on student loans
attributes.background: The threshold for repayment has been increased from £21000 to £25000, but this goes no way towards dealing with the issue of high interest on student loans. Those who leave university with £50000 of debt could potentially be liable for £100k+ repayment over the lifetime of the loan. This is wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Those earning over £45k have to pay top interest rates of 6.3 percent and this can accrue for 30 years. Higher than most mortgages, yet students are expected to still go ahead and get on the property ladder in an already challenging market. Moreover, many graduates in London who are exposed to a higher cost of living (and salary to compensate) will be exposed to the higher interest rate just because of their location.

www.slc.co.uk/students-and-customers/loan-repayment/interest-rates.aspx

attributes.action: Make hate speech against disabled people a criminal offence.
attributes.background: "Disableism" and discrimination based on your physical or cognitive ability has long been both unacceptable socially and legislatively. However, verbal abuse is often the start of such discrimination and has for too long been left as "colloquial" or dismissed as "slang" . It is time for this to end
attributes.additional_details: Children and young people who have additional needs are more likely to end up in a youth offending programme, less likely to have their mental health needs taken seriously and more likely to be lower earners. Our society disadvantages those with any form of disability in subtle ways. Verbal abuse, the use of words that are as insulting to disabled people as the worst racist abuse, are demonstrative of underlying social acceptance of this discrimination. We need to take a stand, make this not just socially unacceptable but criminal.

attributes.action: Deploy carbon capture and storage technology at scale across the UK by 2021.
attributes.background: Runaway climate change will happen unless we dramatically cut emissions within a decade. Carbon capture (CCUS) technology removes up to 90% of CO2 from air, but the UK government intends to deploy it at scale only in the 2030s. We demand that the government rolls out CCUS nationwide by 2021.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that the government:
-	brings forward nationwide CCUS deployment to 2021;
-	provides more funding for CCUS optimisation and supports emissions-cutting CCUS plants regardless of profit;
-	oversees global transfers of CCUS technology and compels overseas states to deploy CCUS.

UN: http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/
CCUS: https://www.worldcoal.org/reducing-co2-emissions/carbon-capture-use-storage 
Gov: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/uk-carbon-capture-and-storage-government-funding-and-support

attributes.action:
Refuse to uphold the NI (Executive Formation and
Exercise of Functions) Bill.
attributes.background: This Bill will compromise democracy in NI, placing decision-making in the hands of unelected civil servants and retrospectively blocking challenges to the Secretary of State's requirement to call an election within a reasonable period of time, an important safeguard to our democratic institutions.
attributes.additional_details: Our government may be currently at a stalemate, but Parliament has no mandate from the people of Northern Ireland to revoke our democratic rights and their safeguards.

attributes.action: Change the Family Law to protect non-resident parents and make contact easy.
attributes.background:
There are parents who have their kids full time, that use the kids as weapons against their ex partners, refusing contact or extra contact to the children, if certain demands are not adhered to. 
This in turn is causing suicide, mental illness, physical illness, and financial hardship.
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be a signed agreement when parents split detailing the days that the non-resident parent can see the kids. This should be done at the local council and be a document that is recognised by the court of law as a binding contract. In addition: 
• CSA should be overhauled to take into account not just the non-resident’s income, but their cost of living. 
• The 48 hour fortnight law should be changed to 53 hours, giving the leaving parent a chance to see their kids after school. An extra one day in a week during school half term should also be introduced.

attributes.action: Bring in a recognised standard of safety for installation of blinds.
attributes.background: For years the blind industry has the good and the bad installers, which is the same in a lot of industries but this can be the case of life or death when cords are involved.
attributes.additional_details: There are many cases of children losing their lives to poorly installed blinds due to the cording.

attributes.action: Require schools to make changes to curriculum and exams for children with SEN
attributes.background: When a children is diagnosed with a learning difficulty by a psychologist they then put in recommendations to the school which the school doesn't or can't put in practice due to cuts in schools. These results from psychologist shouldn't be a recommendation they should be compulsory and funded.
attributes.additional_details: We have been fighting for three years for our daughter to be diagnosed with dyslexia. Now we have, the school has no legal duty to put in recommendations from the psychologist, nor do they have a protocol in place for dyslexia, she has to sit SATs test alongside her peers , yet now has been diagnosed with learning difficulty how can this be fair to the child and true results for the government

attributes.action: Fund a national day and memorial to the sacrifices of LGBT+ campaigners
attributes.background: Fund an annual national day and a physical memorial in London to commemorate the sacrifices of LGBT+ campaigners. We are a divided people so to have this one national day will remind us of the rights we have fought for so the young and old can come together to give hope to future generations.

attributes.action: Require prescriptions to state drug indications
attributes.background: Make drug indications a prescription requirement, so prescribing errors are identified more appropriately. Many drugs have more then one indication(s) (condition(s)) that are treated at different doses or sometimes similar doses.
attributes.additional_details: In addition to this when drugs are prescribed by doctors errors can be made for instance clomifene and clomipramine is a common error, that can be easily identified if the pharmacist had the indication in front of them. Sofradex eye and ear drop dose gets mixed up commonly. This is just to name a few examples. Sign this petition so this requirement is put into place and patient get a double check on their prescriotion to ensure it appropriatly prescribed fo the indication(s) by prescribers.

attributes.action: Move responsibility for the laws on equal marriage from NI back to UK Parliament
attributes.background: The responsibility for the law on equal marriage in NI is devolved to the Northern Ireland Assembly which is currently not sitting. This petition is to move that responsibility back to the UK Parliament, after which a petition to change the law to align with the rest of the UK can be made
attributes.additional_details: As NI is part of the UK, it should have the same laws on issues such as equal marriage when the rest of the UK does. See Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013

attributes.action: Support Parents with Learning Disabilities & Mental Health
attributes.background: Too many parents with complex needs aren’t being supported to parent. Rather than being given a chance with the right support they, have their children removed. It's plain wrong and unfair on the child as well as the parent & needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A service should be created within social services to support parents with learning disabilities and mental health issues to parent and prevent children being taken into care and forced adoptions taking place.

attributes.action: Regulate the transfer of terminally people ill from home to palliative care.
attributes.background: Transfers from home to palliative care usually involve a number of public and commercial services, each following their own safeguarding procedures. However, if serious omissions are to be avoided there is a pressing need for a mechanism which locks these different safeguarding procedures together.
attributes.additional_details:
A central Government initiative, in the form of national protocol or code of practice, would help to ensure that certain standards are achieved by all those involved in transferring the terminally ill from home to palliative care.

Any central Government protocol or code of practice would need to be embedded in the various safeguarding procedures and this should lead to improved collaboration, better communication and a more collaborative way of working for all those involved.

attributes.action: A minimum 6 month driving ban for mobile phone use whilst driving.
attributes.background: I am a Class 1 HGV driver and I am sick to death of people texting and phoning whilst driving. I see dozens of people doing this from my high vantage point in a truck everyday. The current punishment is deterring no one. A ban will make the majority change their habits when livelihoods are at stake.
attributes.additional_details: There are many well documented cases of the death and destruction caused by these selfish drivers.

attributes.action: Referendum asking Britain if there should be a second Brexit referendum.
attributes.background: There are many people calling for a second EU referendum and many people calling for the 2016 result to be upheld. Let’s ask the people if we should indeed have a second referendum with the question: Should there be a second EU referendum to determine whether Britain stays in the EU? Yes or No.

attributes.action: Ban smoking in the Royal Parks
attributes.background: The Royal Parks serve as the 'lungs' of London - a green refuge where Londoners can go to find fresh air in a city with some of the worst air quality in the UK.  As such, this precious space should be kept smoke-free so that people don't have to dodge second hand smoke as they exercise/relax.
attributes.additional_details:
London poor air quality:  
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-38735896
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jan/30/london-reaches-legal-air-pollution-limit-just-one-month-into-the-new-year

Dangers of second-hand smoke:
https://www.nhsinform.scot/healthy-living/stopping-smoking/reasons-to-stop/second-hand-smoke
